intro: Dorstenia prorepens, commonly known as the creeping false arum, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is popular among succulent and tropical plant enthusiasts.
